name: LORD OF THE HUNT: (BARBARIAN 16/ FTR 8/ ROGUE 16)
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
When i said before a few days that i would post some really unique builds i meant it, and this is the second of them after my " Dark Assailant ". And i won't lie about the weaknesses of this particular build either, as many of you will find the hp's lacking for a melee character and the saves aren't so good. Thankfully the bad news stop here and for these small sacrifices you can have the best killer you can find for your money. Have you ever wondered what would happen if you could have a Barbarian that his rage would cause his foes to run in terror from him while he is chopping them down with his Greatsword, delivering Devastating hits with brutal efficiency due to the multiple stacking of EWS/ Crippling Strike & 8 dice of Sneak Attack, all the while he is holding a large weapon with 32 natural Strength? Well time to find out and this is just the beginning, cause this Cat can also find, disable & set all (except gas) deadly traps there is as well, not to mention Hide/ Move Silently, use any magic items under the sun, Taunt his opponents to lower their AC and force them to their knees with his IKD strikes.

Here you go,

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:frankly he is even more powerful now.
Taking Dev. crit. out of the equation and tailoring him for a non-Dev. crit. environment, also removes much of the problem with the mediocre Fort save.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: I don't see how this is relevant, i play Dev. Critters in worlds that is allowed sometimes and that doesn't mean everything out there will have Dev. Crit too, to respond back. In WoG for example there are perhaps a handful, hard boss-type encounters that have it but the rest of them (as it is logical) don't. This character is named " Lord of the Hunt " not Lord of Resistance. I suppose you could sacrifice two general feats in order to take Great Fortitude & Epic Fortitude there, but those changes are to the individual, as is weapon's choice and particular skills.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:I don't see how this is relevant
You pointed out in the original post that one of the weaknesses of the build is the saves. I still applaud the build because it has so much else going for it. An impoortant factor here is that you can neutralize many creatures with the Terrifying rage, so they never will attack you. But there are limits to who can be stopped by TR, and you have to fight those tougher creatures.

My basic assumption is that in balanced mods where Dev. crit. is allowed, you will also meet creatures with Dev. crit., not only in PvP, but also in PvM play, and then you need a way to handle that threat. Immunity to crits eliminates the threat completely (Pale Master). A high AC, Epic Dodge and Self Concealment reduce the threat significantly. If you don't have those, you have to rely on a fair Fort save bonus. If you are up against a fighter with Dev Crit DC 40 (Character-level 40, Str 30), you must roll 18 to survive a critical hit when your Fort save bonus is 22. Then the Hunter suddenly becomes the prey.
Of course you know WoG better than I do, since you have played there a lot. If this isn't a problem there, then of course it isn't relevant there.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This isn't about specific PW's or WoG, but your second comment that confused me. You assumed that Dev, Critical able characters will play in worlds that have also Dev. Critical threats, while the opposite is also true. "Lord of the Hunt" in his two versions is meant to be played in any world, no matter if they allow Dev. Critical for his foes or not. If he is in a party he will just let his good friends tank for him or if he is soloing and with a little forethought he can lay down a deadly or epic even field of traps and lure his foes in that. Then a single stun or delay from a trap is all he needs in order to use his UMD skill and lay down the smack with IGMS scrolls and the like. He has the tools and the means both to deal with those kind of opponents, he won't simply give up.

Heh, believe me i always try to rise the saves of my characters but in some cases like this it simply cannot be done without sacrificing some other part that i think it is vital. Replacing for example two Gr. Strength with Gr. fortitude & Epic fortitude will lower my AB to a point that i would not like for this character and he still would need more than enough luck to make his saving throw against Dev. Critical enemies with a simple 40 DC (in WoG for example where it exists, it is higher than that). Rather than try and be simply good at everything i choose for him to be exceptional in his specific field, which is to kill things effectively and to adapt to many situations thanks to his great skill-set, umd & terrifying rage.

Thanks again for your input, Mick.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
A few comments about the DevCrit version (the first offerred) since only one build per topic is allowed.  Contributors are free to furnish a link to a separate variant topic as long as the variant build has been fully tested just like any other Level 40 contribution.  Anyhoo...
Valerfor wrote:
Naked/ Armoured AC: 20/ 31 (Full plate & T. Shield)
03) Barbarian (01): WF: Greatsword

 
Can't have both.  Either mundane armored AC of 28 or select a 1H weapon to use the shield AC.  Since the damage specs refer to the Greatsword, it is easier to adjust the AC.  Just FYI... a rapier or scimi would have been the superior DevCrit weapon.   So thematic choices can be expensive at times.  This is one.

BTW, WoG is one of the few mid-magic servers that has not (yet!) nerfed or banned DevCrit so don't assume that it is representative of most mid-magic realms.  High-magic PWs, the kind that usually leave DevCrit to work the way BioWare intended, have more typically flushed the spawns with uber-Fort, uber-AC creatures that a DevCritter will swing at with little success.  That's how they balance the dominance of DevCrit quite easily without making more cheesy crit-immune skins or PvP items.
Search: 18 (20)
Set Traps: 13 (15)
--clip--
This character has been set in a way to make use of Epic Traps as well if you so desire with only a small investment of a +2 DEX item that of course in game you will have, only thing that you need is simply to adjust your skill set for that.
 
This build will neither spot default epic traps (need Search 23 or higher) nor set them (need Set Trap 45 or higher).  With INT+6 (to reach the minimum epic Search) you will spot epic traps 1 out of 20 rolls each 3 secs while in active detect mode, each 6 secs in passive. Reaching the DEX cap will accomplish little towards setting epic traps.  Even ESF: Set Traps won't help.

Finally, there are 2 points to spare in UMD that could be used to boost some skill (like Disable Trap up to 21 to recover all deadly but gas).

The actual alignment restriction is: NG/TN/NE/CG/CN/CE, with the author's thematic preference for CN.

edit:  Also, Mick's observation should be reinforced since the author did not modify the build to provide important information:  -20% XP penalty for the entire epic portion (20 levels) of the build.
